page.title: 01The Whitchurch Area
page.content: The Whitchurch area lies south of Bristol.It is dominated by the eastern slopes of Dundry hill,which rise to 197 metres.This is extensively farmed and provides many opportunities for recreational activities. The area has 3 settlements,which are the villages of Queen Charlton,Norton Malreward and Whitchurch.The first two have remained virtually undeveloped, whilst Whitchurch has become a suburb of Bristol,with intensive development during the last 20 years,around the heart of the old village.Steady expansion continues,but on a smaller scale. There is evidence of much earlier occupation.Roman remains have been found near Lyons Court farm.The Wansdyke,a Saxon earthwork,can be seen near Maes Knoll,which is itself an Iron Age Fort on Dundry.
